GET /api.description: responds with a json representation of all the available endpoints of the api

GET /events.description: responds with an array of all of the events

events.title: Paws in the Park
events.description: A fun-filled day in the park.

GET /api/events/:event_id.description: responds with the event object associated with the specified event_id

event.title: Paws in the Park
event.description: A fun-filled day in the park.

GET /api/events/:event_id/attendees.description: responds with an array of all of the attendees for the event with the specified event_id

POST /api/events.description: responds with the event object that was created with the required event details provided

exampleRequest.title: Tails and Trails
exampleRequest.description: We've got tales of many tails on trails

event.title: Tails and Trails
event.description: We've got tales of many tails on trails

PATCH /api/events/:event_id.description: responds with the updated event associated with the specified event_id, leaving the other unedited properties unchanged

exampleRequest.title: New title
exampleRequest.description: A fun-filled day in the park.

event.title: New title
event.description: A fun-filled day in the park.

DELETE /api/events/:event_id.description: removes the event with the specified event_id

GET /api/users.description: responds with an array of user objects with all their properties

GET /api/users/:user_id.description: responds with the user object associated with the specified user_id

GET /api/users/:user_id/attending.description: responds with an object with the string "eventsAttending" as the key, and an array of events as its value for the user with the specified user_id

POST /api/users.description: responds with the user object that was created with the correct properties including the default avatar_url value if one is not specified by the user

POST /api/users/login.description: responds with the user object that was created with their user details if provided correct login credentials

POST /api/users/:user_id/attending.description: responds with an object with the string "eventsAttending" as the key, and an updated array of events as its value for the user with the specified user_id with the added event appended to the array

PATCH /api/users/:user_id.description: responds with the updated user associated with the specified user_id, leaving the other unedited properties unchanged

DELETE /api/users/:user_id.description: removes the user with the specified user_id

DELETE /api/users/:user_id/attending.description: removes the event from the user with the specified user_id's list of events they are currently signed up for
